definition: striving to be first and fearing to be last (idiom); outdoing one another
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)

sentences.english: Should take after the bus , not to vie with each other , not bicheng bit crowded.
sentences.chinese: 乘坐公共汽車應先下後上，勿爭先恐後，勿擠逼搶位。

sentences.english: Dooku noticed that the Gold Team members were all scrambling to board a transport.
sentences.chinese: 杜庫發覺金隊隊員都在爭先恐後地登上飛行器。

sentences.english: Managers are scrambling to provide counseling and a suicide hotline for the young workforce.
sentences.chinese: 經理們爭先恐後地爲年輕勞動力提供諮詢和自殺熱線。

sentences.english: Journalists who were tipped off about the incident raced to the scene.
sentences.chinese: 事先聽到有關此事風聲的新聞記者爭先恐後趕赴現場。

sentences.english: Many communities were scrambling to find the missing;
sentences.chinese: 許多社區在爭先恐後地尋找失蹤者。

sentences.english: The panic - stricken passengers tried to rush the life - boats .
sentences.chinese: 驚慌的旅客爭先恐後，想擠進救生艇。

sentences.english: Visitors swarned to mail the special postcards with certain stampers.
sentences.chinese: 遊客爭先恐後地給家裏郵寄蓋有特別郵戳的明信片。

sentences.english: The men scrambled back into the car and it moved off at a fantastic speed.
sentences.chinese: 那些人爭先恐後地爬上汽車，以驚人的速度開跑了。

sentences.english: On arriving there, everybody went into action in no time. We dug square pits first.
sentences.chinese: 到了目的地後，大家不由分說，爭先恐後地幹起來。

sentences.english: Perhaps to be outdone, jujube scrambling to spit the verdant shoots.
sentences.chinese: 也許是不甘落後，棗樹爭先恐後地吐出了嫩綠的新芽。

sentences.english: On arriving there, everybody went into action in no time.
sentences.chinese: 到了目的地後，大家不由分說，爭先恐後地幹起來。

definition: like a swarm of bees/everyone swarms around pushing and shouting/a hornet's nest
one falls, the next follows (idiom); stepping into the breach to replace fallen comrades/advancing wave upon wave
lit. fight minutes, snatch seconds (idiom); a race against time/making every second count
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
to be eager to give sth a try (idiom)
erhua variant of 一股腦|一股脑[yi1 gu3 nao3]
making up a group, forming a troupe (idiom); in large numbers/as a large crowd
in full swing (idiom)/(in a) frenzy/buzzing with activity
